😫 Why is no one commenting on my posts??? ⬇️

@pixistock 👈follow

Ever ask yourself that?
 
We’ll here’s the secret: “Engagement” varies. You can:

A. Get engagement by having people express their deep opinions about your post topic all the time…

B. Get engagement by giving people something they WANT. Aka. Incentivizing engagement. 

When I say, that as a BUSINESS OWNER, you need to spend as much (if not more) time crafting signature free and paid offers as you do finding interesting trends to post, I mean it. 🤨

What does your audience want? What do they need? What is your unique solution for them?

Generic information is endless. 

It’s content comes a dime a dozen and everyone on this app is saying the same thing. 

While that can be helpful, it won’t get people further into YOUR community and build a group of raving fans. 

Simply put, you get a 26% boost in engagement in 7 days by offering something simple and making it ridiculously easy to get it. 

You need to simplify your call-to-actions, making it easier to comment, so the algorithm boosts your post, therefore furthering your reach. 

To better explain this, I’ve created a completely ✨FREE✨ masterclass tackling this CTA strategy. It’s one of many. 

Interested? ⬇️🌿

👉Comment “TRAINING” below and I’ll send you the link to my newest FREE masterclass breaking down this very exact method that led my business to $1MIL. 

Only 4 more days left to watch it! 😱

🔥 QUESTION: on Instagram, what do you prioritize? ⬇️

@pixistock 👈 follow

1. Building a massive following of whoever’s interested?

2. Building a targeted, niched community that can help you scale?

Mindset mistake: “if I can get a large following that means I’ll have more clients!”

“Everyone I follow has a large following so that must be what works!”

Well yes and no. 

It is a numbers game, but one you may be going about the wrong way. 

We’ve all heard stories of creators with millions followers who also aren’t making any money. 😕

Being follower-focused causes you to put any, and every type of content out there - good, bad and posting just to post. 

Being client-focused results in more quality content that drives the RIGHT type of conversions: website taps, DMs, comments and email sign ups. 

I talk about this type of conversion in my ✨FREE✨ masterclass: The High-Value Content Strategy that led me to a $1MIL. 

If you think this is a class of common info you’ve heard before, think again. 

I’m sharing exactly how I use IG to bring in 100s of qualified leads every month. 

Want in before it closes this week?? ⬇️

💫 Comment “TRAINING” below and I’ll send you the access link today 🙌🏽

🤨 [DO THIS] Here’s what I mean:

@pixistock 👈 follow and favorite

💫 Audience scenario: They just got home from their 9-5, tired, have to get the kids ready to do homework and put food on the table.

❎ Somewhat relevant content:
“5 steps to quitting your 9-5 to have more time-freedom.”

✅ HIGHLY relevant content:
“5 ways I prioritize my side hustle into my busy weekday evening without neglecting my family.”

💫 Audience scenario: A product launch is coming up in a few days, and they’re frustrated that their site is unprepared. They’ve done all they know to do but something about it doesn’t feel dynamic enough. 

❎ Somewhat relevant content:
“How to change your copy to increase your website conversions.”

✅ HIGHLY relevant content:
“10 crucial sales page areas to check for bad copy so you make more sales on your next launch.”

💫 Audience scenario: They just got out of yet another long verbal argument with their spouse. They storm off and the house is dead silent yet again. 

❎ Somewhat relevant content:
“How to make your marriage better and finally stop arguing with your spouse.”

✅ HIGHLY relevant content:
“6 powerfully effective phrases to say that diffuse arguments so there’s more peace in your home.”

——————

1. Know the ✨actual✨ problems your audience struggles with. (Get specific)

2. Brainstorm the individual, negative scenarios that affect in their daily life. 

3. Tailor your hooks and headlines to highlight them.

You’ll make more relevant content that’ll change their mindset, compelling them to take the next step with, not just ANY brand…

✨YOUR BRAND✨😉

5 EASY ways to do this in your content: ⬇️

@pixistock 👈 follow and favorite

✨ Before you post another motivational quote from another author, sit with it. 

Reflect on how this statement actually applies to your audience’s journey and practical ways they can apply it to their life. Then share it with your own original take. 

✨ Author your own original quotes. 

Use a Twitter screenshot or a simple quote template to share thoughts and beliefs signature to YOU. Create a list of pain points your audience has and write an original idea that tackles it.

✨ What are the buzzwords in your industry? 

Craft posts that define them in a deeper way, giving you an opportunity to stand out - instead of sounding like a broken record. 

✨Share thought-provoking personal stories and experiences that capture attention. 

“Here’s why I don’t ______.”
“The one _____ I won’t ever use in my routine.”
“Why I stopped ____ and started ____ instead.”
“What I don’t like about ____.”

✨State more claims in your video hooks. ⬇️

“____ is not a replacement for ___. Let me explain…”
“There’s no such thing as ____. Here’s my proof…”
“If you’re a ____, you cannot ____ without _____. Let me break this down…”
“_____ is a lie. Here’s how I found this out.”

One of the 8 high-value content types (challenge assumptions) from my masterclass will help you with this. 

Not only that training, but my hooks and headlines class coming soon will change the way you create every piece of content moving forward. 🤨

Want to learn about both?

💣 There’s something you need to know about your Instagram content: ⬇️

[@pixistock 👈follow and favorite for social media and business growth strategy]

Only “high-value” content, that is, content that makes your audience think DIFFERENTLY about their current situation, will consistently bring in the sales you seek. 

Sales, new clients, customers - raving fans who will shout your brand from the rooftops for you 💁‍♀️

For the business owner, the goal isn’t to have the most funny, cool or trendy social media posts. 

It feels nice, but it’s not sustainable. 

The goal is to build desire and demand for an ✨offer✨ - something people actually WANT. 

You do that by:

☝🏽Making your audience more aware of an burning problem - a problem that’s costing them time or money…

✌🏽Urging them to see their situation another way, while highlighting the need for your solution. 

There’s an art to this - a skill that every serious online entrepreneur must master. 

If you want to learn exactly how to craft irresistible offers and build desire & demand for them on Instagram…

⬇️ Excuses I used for so long. 😅 5 reasons, I “didn’t feel like it.”

@pixistock👈 follow and favorite

1. I was preoccupied by other areas of my business that I thought needed equal or more attention. 

2. I felt like my content was going into a black hole - no rhyme or reason, no strategy, no direction - “no one would see it anyway.” 

3. I felt like my content was “creative enough” or even that my content message was “clear enough” (even though results didn’t reflect it). 

4. I didn’t feel like I had the personality type to create content in a way that would draw the best kind of attention and followers. 

5. I felt like the algorithms were biased anyway, favoring larger accounts. So what’s the point of posting?

—— ✨ ➡️ Which of these excuses have you said before in your own journey? Comment below. 🌿

Not only do these mindsets hinder personal growth, they keep you in a cycle of inaction. 

Yes content creation takes work. 🤨

It takes brainstorming, planning and direction. 

But that’s the beauty of it. 😌 You GET to prioritize the thing that when executed the RIGHT WAY - when done consistently and with direction - can give you the time-freedom in your life and business you ultimately desire.
 
Take responsibility, learn new skills, adapt and make the necessary improvements to your content to succeed. 

Need help? 

✨Head to my bio✨ and grab the masterclass bundle that’ll teach you everything you need to know to effectively market you brand on social media. 😉

8 powerful lessons learned in 8 years: ⬇️

@pixistock 👈 follow and favorite for content marketing and business strategy for women

▪️ you can build a million-dollar business without having a large follower count. 

▪️the quality of your products, services and offerings matter way more than the “quality” of your content. (not mentioned enough)

▪️you can’t ignore your spiritual and mental health, as it’s all you have when things fall apart. 

▪️setting boundaries in your life and business gives you freedom to do everything you truly desire.

▪️nobody cares about the messy kitchen or office in your video. but they do care about your message. 

▪️bigger than your “why,” your business needs to be something you truly enjoy. we’re consistent with the things that light us up inside. 

▪️adding digital products to your offer suite can seriously fuel the growth of ANY other area you’re passionate in - physical product shop, custom services, mission work, and more. 

▪️stop arguing with strangers on social media. it’s unproductive, futile and doesn’t add one more dollar to your bank account. 

Do any of these resonate with you? 🤗🌿

How in the world do you show social proof when you don’t have much? 🤔⬇️

@pixistock👈 follow and favorite for content creation tips and content strategy

Instead of simply telling your audience that you get results for people (like most of us do), stand out by showing results you’ve either gotten yourself or gotten your clients/customers. 

If you’re low on getting results for others, it’s okay to flaunt results of your own - they are equally legit. 

Remember, results don’t have to be monetary. 

Use this audio sound to show off the desired result you audience is looking to achieve. That can be:

▪️”you really lost ____ in 1 year?” Share a before and after pic.

▪️”You seriously collect that many ____ [object]?” Show off a collection your audience dreams to have.

▪️”You’ve honestly traveled to that many _____ [places]?” Share a screenshot of a map. 

▪️”You honestly have read ____?” Share a book collection. 

▪️”You weren’t kidding when you said you _____ [insert a habit people think is far-fetched]? Share a screenshot of results from doing that habit. 

▪️”You seriously did X without Y?” [Show a pic of the end result]

What do you think? You think you’ll try this Reel idea for your business?

HOW to attract the RIGHT people: ⬇️

@pixistock 👈follow

▪️Step 1: create a solid product, service or offer for a very specific type of person. 

▪️Step 2: Be the face of your brand and show up on social media as the person you want to attract.

▪️Step 3: Refine your content’s focus, putting on display the struggles, challenges, needs, pain points and desires your dream avatar has.

▪️Step 4: Tune your copy and message within your content and your websites to speak directly to the areas in step 3.

▪️Step 5: provide immense value daily, in the specific area your dream avatar wants to see results in. 

People follow who they see themselves AS, or who they inspire to be. They follow people who achieved what they want to achieve. They buy from people who display the result they want for themselves. 

Simply be that person. Show up as that person, everyday. 

And you’ll attract the right people to your brand. 

(Who knows, one day the “most” people will include the “right” people too 😉)

Don’t quit a strategy just because it’s not working *right now.* ⬇️

@pixistock 👈 follow for content marketing tips 

Too often we ditch a perfectly good marketing strategy because we think it didn’t give us results fast enough. 

You’ll never get to a million followers or a million dollars in your business by stopping and starting a new hack, strategy or method every other day. 

If you truly want results with any marketing strategy you’ve committed to:

▪️ Be realistic about the results you hope to gain. 

Ex: Don’t expect 100 followers a day if you’re only posting 2x a month. 

▪️Eliminate distractions when you’re in the process of trying a new method. 

Ex: Consuming content that’s counterproductive to the strategy you’ve committed to implement. 

▪️See it all the way through to the end. 

Ex: You’re doing a 30-day video content challenge but you stop at 7 days because it’s “too hard.” 

▪️Set goals and hold yourself accountable. 

Ex: Don’t say you’ve tried this or that and you honestly haven’t given it 110% and marked your process along the way.

Remember, quitting and pivoting are 2 different things. If you can honestly say you’ve given your all, and a content or marketing strategy isn’t working for you, it’s okay to pivot at the end.

But don’t quit when you’ve barely even started. 😉🌿Does this resonate with you?

Ah, the sweet symphony of unsolicited DMs 🎶😆.

Is the day even complete if you haven’t yet opened your IG to a cascade of ‘wanna grow your account by 50k+’ messages in the request folder?

@pixistock 👈follow and favorite

This sales tactic is akin to throwing spaghetti at the wall and hoping something sticks - a classic move but one that’s not going to get you very far. 

It’s not that you can’t directly reach out to people in your target audience. 

It’s not even that you can’t offer them your services in the DMs. 

But you can’t expect to build a trustworthy brand with a line out the door, using this one-size-fits-all approach. 

Instead: 

▪️Foster a genuine interest in your ideal prospect. Do you even follow them? Have you immersed yourself in their world as much as you want to be in theirs?

▪️If someone you’ve found is truly a good fit for your service just based on you browsing their profile, engage authentically. Engage with their posts, right there in the feed, which shows you actually want to get to know them. 

▪️Do the work to properly and consistently promote your free and paid offers on your feed in non-salesy ways. People should already be aware of what you offer without you having to DM them anything. 

▪️Add DM-initiated call-to-actions to your post. “DM me the word ‘READY’ and let’s chat about…” This opens the door for PERMISSION-based marketing. They’ve given you permission to DM them back, and that’s your in.

Above all, provide value first. 

Call me old-fashioned, but I still believe in the magic of organic interactions and genuine connections.

To all the solicitors writing paragraphs and paragraphs of sales DMs out there, at this point, it’s embarrassing. 

But I admire your hustle. 

Focus on attraction-based marketing rather than outbound marketing, and you might just have a shot at winning over some new clients! 🌿

When was the last time you received one of these messages in your DMs? 😆⬇️

There are numerous tips circulating about “growing your Instagram” and “building your audience.”

It’s definitely good stuff.

But zoning in on these areas could save your business, NO MATTER your audience size.

Often, when I encounter struggling brands across various niches, I see 3 major issues:

▪️A product, service, or offer that seems appealing but doesn't fully resonate.

Something prospects “kind of” want.

(Ex: a reflection journal with an attractive cover but blank pages inside.)

▪️An outcome or solution that sounds intriguing but remains vague and ambiguous.

(Ex: “I help you harness your focus and live your best life.”)

▪️A purchasing pathway laden with distractions or barriers that prevent potential customers from easily saying ‘YES.’

(Ex: Pop-ups on a website, too many options, prerequisites like “call first,” lengthy application processes, extended email sequences, etc.)

As I highlighted in my previous post, CLEAR = CASH, every single time.

If you're grappling with making sales – be it for the simplest digital or physical products…

…look deeper into these 3 domains.

Pinpoint the weaknesses. 

It’s likely NOT your content that's at fault.

Is the issue with your offer?
The promise you make?
Your method?

Or perhaps the journey potential clients must undertake to acquire it?

Clarifying each could be the key to saving your business. 💫

💥You’re losing followers, here’s why 

@pixistock👈follow

The amount of followers you lose daily could be a direct result of the type of content on your page.

You may post frequently. 

You may be posting Reels for reach. 

But inconsistency could be a deterrent. 

🤔 Think of how you consume content. 

When you check out a new account, you stay for a while, you binge a few videos and it gets you into a flow. 

Then you come across a highly unrelated post and it instantly interrupts that flow. 

This happens once, twice, five, ten times and then you leave clearly seeing that this content isn’t for you. 

It’s the same with your account. 📲

The more distractions and interruptions on your feed, the more you confuse prospects. 

Which is why it’s vital to have separate, focused pages for each business you have, and your personal accounts.

Because the more focused your content, the quicker prospects can make a buying decision. 

But if every other day you’re posting about a new product, concept, or experience, you make it hard for people to want to stick around…

…✨for something specific.✨

I had to learn this the hard way.

When I first started my business, I would lazily post about broad topics, without thinking deeply about the specific issues my prospects dealt with. 

But here’s the thing:

Oftentimes, we don’t stand out because we remain in the “generic” realm. 

The safe realm where most of us snuggle up comfortably.

But to win your audience, 80% of your content’s copy should narrow in on the very specific problems they face. 

Here are some examples:

Broad: “I help you eliminate routine overwhelm.”
Specific: “I help you create an energy-filled, weekday, AM routine that easily prioritizes both you and your family…”

Broad: “I help you improve your relationships…”
Specific: “You’ll know exactly what to say to remove unwanted people in your life using this 3-part script.”

Broad: “You’ll be able to sleep better.”
Specific: “For the first time in weeks you won’t be checking the clock every hour of the night.”

Broad: “How to create digital products.”
Specific: “How to start a digital product business from scratch with no audience and no creative ideas.” 

Broad: “You’ll learn how to grow using Reels.”
Specific: “You’ll finally get past 1000 video views in the first month of using this strategy even if you feel like no one’s watching currently.”

👉The key is to dig deeper and agitate the areas of life that prospects are challenged with daily. 

A👏🏽GI👏🏽TATE👏🏽 lol

That’s how you get people to pay attention. 

And this will separate you from others in your niche. 😉🌿

😩 HOW TO FIX IT ⬇️

@pixistock 👈 follow + favorite 

Ok, I know you want a solution. But here’s the thing. 

You can’t fix it 😬😆.

Why?

Because there’s really nothing to “fix.”

Certain videos will inevitably captivate consumers more than others. 

This is why your content plan overall must be strategic.

Now…😌

There are some changes you can make to your promo videos to increase views:

1. SHOW us the product (especially for my digital product entrepreneurs). Don’t just tell us about it. 

Stop teaching concepts around it, and start making THE THING real to us. 

2. Add an element of humor. One way I do this in my best performing IG ads is showing the “before” and “after.” 

What method do prospects use currently that’s obviously not working but very hilarious? 

Show that on video with trending audio. On the beat drop, cut to a clip of your digital product as the “true” solution.

3. Shorten your promo videos. Include a dynamic hook at the beginning, highlighting a major pain point. Agitate the problem as you talk on video, and end with your offer as the solution. 

45 secs or less. 

4. Play off popular current events or memes (like this one) and share your offer in the caption focusing on the pain prospects are running from.

5. Boost reach by including simple call-to-actions. 

“Comment ‘ME’ if you want [offer].” “Drop the 🔥 emoji if you’re ready…” “Give me a ‘YES’ in the comments to…

Remember, not all content should perform the same way. 

Not all content is meant to go viral. 

That’s why it’s important to have a micro content focus so your audience always knows what to expect from you and is ready to engage with it.🌿

💥Questions you should be asking ⬇️

@pixistock 👈 follow & favorite…

…and give me a 🔥 in the comments if this video made sense.

To convert followers, your content needs to speak to your audience’s pain points, problems and challenges.

If you struggle with this, ask yourself these questions to figure it out:

✅ Where do prospects feel the most frustration?

✅ What time of day do they find their struggle is harder?

✅ What methods currently aren’t working?

✅ What annoyances hammer on them that just won’t let up?

✅ What have they been struggling to find in this area?

✅ What specific tasks make the problem worse?

✅ Who in their life potentially makes the problem appear worse?

✅ What situation will often throw them off?

✅ What conversations are going on in their head?

✅ What situational roadblocks continue to stand in their way?

✅ What areas of friction prevent them from getting results?

Not all these questions will be applicable to your business…

…but this starting point will allow you to create more high-value content for the people you’re trying to serve. 

So go deep. 

Get under the fingernails of the issue and bring it into light. 

This is how your brand will stand out and how followers *actually* become customers, quicker. 🌿

So it’s okay if you’re not where you want to be right now. Manage your expectations and put up the right boundaries. 

Your path might not be the one everyone else is taking, or the one the gurus preach about, but it’s the one leading you to where you need to be.

💥 HOW TO RAPIDLY BUILD TRUST with your audience 🤔⬇️

@pixistock 👈 follow + favorite

If you haven’t noticed, your followers are skeptical. 

About pretty much everything on social media. 

It’s your job to ease this skepticism as quickly as possible if you want growth, followers or sales.

(Break through the competing conversations going on in their head)

If you arbitrarily post just to fill your feed with “information” or “products,” it’s always going to be hard to get people to follow and buy. 

Reason is -

They don’t trust you yet (but they will).

You wouldn’t expect someone to lend you their car keys before you’ve proven you can drive. 🫠 

Or expect a tip before you’ve served the meal. 

Starting today:

Share more content that speaks to the actual problems, pain points, challenges, struggles, experiences, desires and goals your audience has. 

They NEED to know that you “get them.” 

That you understand the REAL issues that hit close to home. 

This can be challenging, creatively.

▫️How do I do this on video?

How NOT to fall into this trap ⬇️

@pixistock 👈 follow + favorite

▪️Know the content categories you’ll focus on before you start. 

Are you creating entertaining content today? Educational? Try sticking to one type to make video recording easy. Jumping to and from various post types can cause you to lose momentum. 

▪️Go back and use the audio you’ve saved instead of finding new ones. 

Your Reels audio is collecting dust on that saved list. Don’t sift through new audio until you’ve looked back at what you’ve saved first. This will keep you from getting caught consuming instead of creating.

▪️Plan your content ideas in advance. 

Can’t stress this enough. It may seem like a lot of work at first, but that advanced planning gives room to explore some thought-provoking, creative ideas rather than throwing something half-quality together each day. 

This is what your audience needs more of on social media.

▪️Manage your creation time.

As you batch create, spend no more than 15 minutes recording each piece content. Don’t overthink the post. Save it to drafts. Good is good enough. 

Even if it’s just 3-5 posts in one session, batch creating content is one of the best ways to remain consistent on IG and produce higher value content. 

If you don’t already, try it!

Looking back on social media in 2023, there was a lot things we all complained about - not just related the platform changes but within the content we consumed. 

Whether you’re on YT, TT, FB, X, or IG, there was this common thread of inauthenticity across the board. 

And no, I’m not talking about using filters or putting on makeup as a way to display your authenticity.

I’m talking about the mass desire creators had to sell you something, exaggerate, and inflate - even the over-influencing of products and services that we found we didn’t really need. 

Audiences became more savvy to marketing gimmicks that would then tank your engagement. 

People could clearly see the tactics used to inflate video views, or the empty downloads that didn’t really solve their problems. 

If we’re going to sell products and services via social media, as business owners, I feel like we need to go back to what it truly means to be authentic and genuine.

All of this can’t just be about gaining follower numbers. 
It can’t just be about “making X amount of money in Y time.”
It can’t just be about hitting 1M video views.

Our content has to come from a place of empathy - a genuine desire to serve our audience and solve real problems that are hindering them from success. 

No one can teach you this. 

It comes from passion. 

So just think about that as you create content in 2024. 

Try to dig deeper, pulling genuine stories from your own life experiences, challenges, setbacks and wins, ultimately realizing that in order to be successful, you don’t need tricks and hacks, you just need to consistently show up, authentically as YOU.
